column4: I'm running 8.04 and trying to upgrade to 9.04.  sudo do-release-upgrade Checking for a new ubuntu release No new release found. Is this still the correct wayto upgrade?
that's, because 8.04 is a LTS release  and  by default it only shows other LTS as upgrade
why do you want to upgrade to 9.04?
To get my Canon mx700 working
What?  that doesn't sound right,  Canon aren't exactly Linux friendly
so if it doesn't work with 8.04, it probably won't in 9.04 or 9.10 either
Canon AU has linux drivers for it. Found several sets of instructions on the forums claiming it works in the "9" releases
ok uhmm  normalley I would just tell people to stay on 8.04  that have it at the moment, want to know why?
I mean stay on 8.04,  untill 10.04, which they can then directly upgrade to since it's the next LTS, that's released end of April
I am just trying to get an old machine running with the printer as a print server. My other machines are 8.04
upgrading to 9.04,  that should work no problem,  but upgrading from 9.04 to 9.10, might go wrong on you
you just got to get it showing non LTS releases
kind of, but I am not on Ubuntu right now, ( another distro actsaully )
